properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued March 2 at 4:43PM MST until March 4 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Glasgow MT
properties.description:
...Ice Jam on the Yellowstone River Has Created a High River Level Near
Glendive...

.An Ice Jam near Glendive has forced high river levels near
Glendive, approaching Flood Stage Monday Afternoon. Some reports
of low-land flooding has occurred in the area.

The National Weather Service in Glasgow has issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for a portion of northeast Montana,
including the following area, Dawson County, near Glendive.

* Through Wednesday afternoon

* An ice jam has formed in the Glendive area, making river levels
increase and was causing low-land flooding in the Glendive area.
If the ice jam holds, levels will continue to rise until it
breaks loose.

* If the jam breaks loose, then areas downriver could experience a
sudden rush of water.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings or Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
